00032 // An AttrTable is a table of attributes (type-name-value tuples).
00033 
00034 #ifndef _attrtable_h
00035 #define _attrtable_h 1
00036 
00037 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00038 #ifdef __GNUG__
00039 #pragma interface
00040 #endif
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #include <string>
00044 #include <vector>
00045 
00046 #include "Pix.h"
00047 
00048 #ifndef _error_h
00049 #include "Error.h"

00052 using std::vector;
00053 using std::string;
00054 using std::ostream;
00055 using std::vector;
00056 
00077 enum AttrType {
00078     Attr_unknown,
00079     Attr_container,
00080     Attr_byte,
00081     Attr_int16,
00082     Attr_uint16,
00083     Attr_int32,
00084     Attr_uint32,
00085     Attr_float32,
00086     Attr_float64,
00087     Attr_string,
00088     Attr_url
00089 };
00090 
00132 class AttrTable {
00133 public:
00138     struct entry {
00139     string name;
00140     AttrType type;
00141     
00142     bool is_alias;
00143         string aliased_to;
00144 
00145     // If type == Attr_container, use attributes to read the contained
00146     // table, otherwise use attr to read the vector of values.
00147     AttrTable *attributes;
00148     std::vector<string> *attr;  // a vector of values. jhrg 12/5/94
00149 
00150     entry(): name(""), type(Attr_unknown), is_alias(false),
00151          aliased_to("") {
00152         attributes = 0;
00153         attr = 0;
00154     }
00155 
00156     entry(const entry &rhs) {
00157         clone(rhs);
00158     }
00159 
00160     void delete_entry() {
00161         if (is_alias)   // alias copies the pointers.
00162         return;
00163         if (type == Attr_container) {
00164         delete attributes; attributes = 0;
00165         }
00166         else {
00167         delete attr; attr = 0;
00168         }
00169     }
00170 
00171     virtual ~entry() {
00172         delete_entry();
00173     }
00174     
00175     void clone(const entry &rhs) {
00176         name = rhs.name;
00177         type = rhs.type;
00178         is_alias = rhs.is_alias;
00179         aliased_to = rhs.aliased_to;
00180         switch (rhs.type) {
00181           case Attr_unknown:
00182         break;
00183           case Attr_container: {
00184           AttrTable *src_atp = rhs.attributes;
00185           AttrTable *dest_atp = new AttrTable(*src_atp);
00186           attributes = dest_atp;
00187           break;
00188           }
00189           default: {
00190           std::vector<string> *src_attr = rhs.attr;
00191           std::vector<string> *dest_attr = new std::vector<string>(*src_attr);
00192           attr = dest_attr;
00193           break;
00194           }
00195         }
00196     }
00197 
00198     entry &operator=(const entry &rhs) {
00199         if (this != &rhs) {
00200         delete_entry();
00201         clone(rhs);
00202         }
00203         return *this;
00204     }
00205     };
00206 
00207 private:
00208     string d_name;
00209     std::vector<entry *> attr_map;
00210 
00211 public:
00212     typedef std::vector<entry *>::const_iterator Attr_citer ;
00213     typedef std::vector<entry *>::iterator Attr_iter ;
00214 
00215     friend class AttrTableTest;
00216 
00217 private:
00218     Pix simple_find(const string &target);
00219 
00220     Attr_iter simple_find( const string &target, bool unused ) ;
00221     AttrTable *simple_find_container(const string &target);
00222 
00223     string AttrType_to_String(const AttrType at);
00224     AttrType String_to_AttrType(const string &s);
00225 
00226     void delete_attr_table();
00227 
00228 protected:
00229     void clone(const AttrTable &at);
00230 
00231     void simple_print(ostream &os, string pad, Attr_iter &i,
00232               bool dereference);
00233 
00234     void simple_print(FILE *out, string pad, Attr_iter &i,
00235               bool dereference);
00236 
00237 public:
00238     AttrTable();
00239     AttrTable(const AttrTable &rhs);
00240     virtual ~AttrTable();
00241     AttrTable & operator=(const AttrTable &rhs);
00242 
00243     void erase();
00244 
00245     unsigned int get_size() const;
00246     string get_name();
00247     void set_name(const string &n);
00248 
00249     unsigned int append_attr(const string &name, const string &type, 
00250                  const string &value) throw (Error);
00251     unsigned int append_attr(const char *name, const char *type, 
00252                  const char *value) throw (Error);
00253 
00254     AttrTable *append_container(const string &name) throw (Error);
00255     AttrTable *append_container(AttrTable *at, const string &name) 
00256     throw (Error);
00257 
00258     void find(const string &target, AttrTable **at, Attr_iter &iter);
00259     AttrTable *find_container(const string &target);
00260 
00261     AttrTable *get_attr_table(const string &name);
00262     AttrTable *get_attr_table(const char *name);
00263 
00264     string get_type(const string &name);
00265     string get_type(const char *name);
00266 
00267     AttrType get_attr_type(const string &name);
00268     AttrType get_attr_type(const char *name);
00269 
00270     unsigned int get_attr_num(const string &name);
00271     unsigned int get_attr_num(const char *name);
00272 
00273     string get_attr(const string &name, unsigned int i = 0);
00274     string get_attr(const char *name, unsigned int i = 0);
00275 
00276     vector<string> *get_attr_vector(const string &name);
00277     vector<string> *get_attr_vector(const char *name);
00278 
00279     void del_attr(const string &name, int i = -1);
00280 
00281     Pix first_attr();
00282     void next_attr(Pix p);
00283     AttrTable::entry *attr(Pix p);
00284     string get_name(Pix p);
00285     bool is_container(Pix p);
00286     AttrTable *get_attr_table(Pix p);
00287     string get_type(Pix p);
00288     AttrType get_attr_type(Pix p);
00289     unsigned int get_attr_num(Pix p);
00290     string get_attr(Pix p, unsigned int i = 0);
00291     vector<string> *get_attr_vector(Pix p);
00292     Pix find(const string &target, AttrTable **at);
00293 
00294     Attr_iter attr_begin();
00295     Attr_iter attr_end();
00296     Attr_iter get_attr_iter(int i);
00297     string get_name(Attr_iter &iter);
00298     bool is_container(Attr_iter &iter);
00299     AttrTable *get_attr_table(Attr_iter &iter);
00300     string get_type(Attr_iter &iter);
00301     AttrType get_attr_type(Attr_iter &iter);
00302     unsigned int get_attr_num(Attr_iter &iter);
00303     string get_attr(Attr_iter &iter, unsigned int i = 0);
00304     std::vector<string> *get_attr_vector(Attr_iter &iter);
00305 
00306     void add_container_alias(const string &name, AttrTable *src) 
00307     throw (Error);
00308     void add_value_alias(AttrTable *das, const string &name, 
00309              const string &source) throw (Error);
00310     bool attr_alias(const string &alias, AttrTable *at, const string &name);
00311     bool attr_alias(const string &alias, const string &name);
00312 
00313     void print(ostream &os, string pad = "    ", bool dereference = false);
00314 
00315     void print(FILE *out, string pad = "    ", bool dereference = false);
00316 };

00409  * I added those where they were needed.
00410  * In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00411  * just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00412  * before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00413  * just good form when using delete.

00415  * making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00416  * set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00417  * comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00418  * characters on their own.

00531  * Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:34:55  jimg
00532  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00533  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00534  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00535  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00536  * class represenation.
00537  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00538  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00539  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00540  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00541  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00542  * C would store them.
00543  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00544  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00545  * objects).

00576  * Revision 1.3  1994/09/09  15:26:41  jimg

00578  * operator>>. It seems best to define all operators from a set (like <<, >>)
00579  * or none at all. Since parse() is the input mfunc, it seems that output
00580  * should be a mfunc too.
00581  *' comments and rcsid[] variables (syntax errors due to //
00582  * comments caused compilation failures.

00586  * Class which inherits from AttrVHMap. This is the class that is contained by
00587  * the DAS mapping class. In addition to the methods defined by the AttrVHMap
00588  * class, this class defines operator<<. It also declares a static class
00589  * variable String empty which is defined in AttrTable.cc to be "".
00590  * Also in this file is a typedef for a pointer to an AttrTable (that is the
00591  * type actually held by the DAS container class).
00592  */
